content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 16 to node 18 is:


```lua
16->21->18
```
Note that you said that for the same graph, if the endpoint was changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point. So, if we change node 18 to node 17, the shortest path would be:


```lua
16->21->17
```
This is because the shortest path from node 16 to node 17 is node 21, which is the same as the shortest path from node 16 to node 18.

The shortest path from node 16 to node 21 is:


```lua
16->21
```
Note that this is the shortest path that doesn't involve any intermediate nodes. The only path connecting nodes 16 and 21 is through node 21 itself, so the shortest path is just that path.
